function onSave()
  local state = {}
  state.SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID = SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID
  state.SelectedNationsGUID = SelectedNationsGUID
  state.SavedPositionsGUID = SavedPositionsGUID
  state.SoloGame = SoloGame
  state.BotColor = BotColor
  state.BotScoreType = BotScoreType
  state.SoloSelectForWho = SoloSelectForWho
  return JSON.encode(state)
end

function onLoad(save_data)
    if save_data ~= "" then
        data = JSON.decode(save_data)
        SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID = data.SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID
        SelectedNationsGUID = data.SelectedNationsGUID
        SavedPositionsGUID = data.SavedPositionsGUID
        SoloGame = data.SoloGame
        BotColor = data.BotColor
        BotScoreType = data.BotScoreType
        SoloSelectForWho = data.SoloSelectForWho
    end

    math.randomseed(os.time())

    ButtonBoard = getObjectFromGUID(ButtonBoardGUID)

    --createRecallButtons()
    --createCalculateScoreButton()
end

-- If there are enough players with selected nations, returns true
function playerNationSelectedSafetyCheck()
    local unreadyPlayers = {}
    local players = getSeatedPlayersWithHands()

    if SoloGame then
      playerCount = 2
    end

    for _, player in ipairs(players) do
      -- Check to see if selected nation
      if SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID[player] == nil then
        table.insert(unreadyPlayers, player)

        local name = Player[player].steam_name
        if SoloGame and player == BotColor then
          name = "BOT"
          broadcastToAll("Please select a nation for the " .. BotColor .. " Bot.", Player[player].color)
        else
          if name == nil then
            name = player
          end
          broadcastToAll(name .. " needs to select a nation before the game can start.", Player[player].color)
        end
      end
    end

    return #players - #unreadyPlayers >= playerCount
end

function setupClassic()
    cardSetGUID = classicSetGUID
    for _, deckGuid in pairs(legendSetGUID) do
        deck = getObjectFromGUID(deckGuid)
        getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck)
    end

    playerCountMenu()
end

function setupImperium()
    cardSetGUID = legendSetGUID
    for _, deckGuid in pairs(classicSetGUID) do
        deck = getObjectFromGUID(deckGuid)
        getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck)
    end

    playerCountMenu()
end

function setupMix()
    cardSetGUID = {}

    for i, deckGuid in pairs(classicSetGUID) do
        if math.random(1,2) == 1 then
            table.insert(cardSetGUID, classicSetGUID[i])
            deck = getObjectFromGUID(legendSetGUID[i])
            getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck)
        else
            table.insert(cardSetGUID, legendSetGUID[i])
            deck = getObjectFromGUID(classicSetGUID[i])
            getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck)
        end
    end

    playerCountMenu()
end

function twoPlayersClick()
    playerCount = 2
    dealCount = 6

    startLuaCoroutine(self, "setupCo")
end

function threePlayersClick()
    playerCount = 3
    dealCount = 7

    startLuaCoroutine(self, "setupCo")
end

function fourPlayersClick()
    playerCount = 4
    dealCount = 8

    startLuaCoroutine(self, "setupCo")
end

function startGameClick()
    if SoloGame then
        if playerNationSelectedSafetyCheck() then
          playerCount = 2
          dealCount = 6
          startLuaCoroutine(self, "setupCo")
        end
    else
        -- determine player count
        playerCount = #getSeatedPlayersWithHands()
        if playerNationSelectedSafetyCheck() then
            if playerCount <= 2 then
                dealCount = 6
            elseif playerCount == 3 then
                dealCount = 7
            else
                dealCount = 8
            end
            startLuaCoroutine(self, "setupCo")
        end
    end
end

function contains(arr, value)
  for _, v in ipairs(arr) do
    if v == value then
      return true
    end
  end

  return false
end

function removeCardFromDeck(deckGuid, cardGuid)
  local deck = getObjectFromGUID(deckGuid)
  if deck ~= nil then
    local trashBag = getObjectFromGUID(TrashId)
    local params = ({
      guid = cardGuid,
      position = trashBag.getPosition()
    })

    trashBag.putObject(deck.takeObject(params))
  end
end

function removeNationTributaryCardFromDeck(powerCardGuid)
  local targetGuids = RemoveTributarySetupGUID['_' .. powerCardGuid]
  if targetGuids ~= nil then
    removeCardFromDeck(targetGuids[1], targetGuids[2])
  end
end

function removeSelectedNationFromTributaries()
  for _, player in ipairs(Players) do
    local zone = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerRegionsGUID[player].power)
    for _, obj in ipairs(zone.getObjects()) do
      if obj.type == 'Card' then
        removeNationTributaryCardFromDeck(obj.guid)
      elseif obj.type == 'Deck' then
        for _, card in ipairs(obj.getObjects()) do
          removeNationTributaryCardFromDeck(card.guid)
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

function removeUnselectedNations()
  for _, guid in ipairs(NationPowerCardsGUID) do
    if SelectedNationsGUID["_" .. guid] == nil then
      removeNation(guid)
    end
  end
end

-- guid is the nation's power card
function removeNation(guid)
  local trashBag = getObjectFromGUID(TrashId)
  local card = getObjectFromGUID(guid)

  if card == nil then
    broadcastToAll("Can't remove nation with GUID:" .. guid .. ". Object not found.", {1, 0, 0})
    return
  end

  local cardSet = card.getVar('CardSet')
  for _, v in pairs(cardSet) do
    if type(v) == 'table' then
      for _, w in ipairs(v) do
        trashBag.putObject(getObjectFromGUID(w))
      end
    else
      trashBag.putObject(getObjectFromGUID(v))
    end
  end
end

function setupCo()
    ButtonBoard.destroy()

    removeSelectedNationFromTributaries()
    removeUnselectedNations()

    w(0.1)

    for i, deckGuid in pairs(cardSetGUID) do
        deck = getObjectFromGUID(deckGuid)
        deckContent = deck.getObjects()
        if playerCount == 2 then
            for i, object in ipairs(deckContent) do
                if contains(object.tags, "P3") or contains(object.tags, "P4") then
                    CardGuid=object.guid
                    local params = {
                        position = getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).getPosition(),
                        guid = CardGuid
                    }
                    getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck.takeObject(params))
                    w(0.1)
                end
            end
        elseif playerCount == 3 then
            for _, object in ipairs(deckContent) do
                if contains(object.tags, "P4") then
                    CardGuid=object.guid
                    local params = {
                        position = getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).getPosition(),
                        guid = CardGuid
                    }
                    getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck.takeObject(params))
                    w(0.1)
                end
            end
        end

        if i < 4 then
            for y=1, dealCount do
                deck.takeObject({
                position          = posDecks[i],
                rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 180.00},
                smooth            = true,
            })
            deck.setPositionSmooth(posDecks[5])
            end
        elseif i == 4 then --Glory
            deck.setPositionSmooth(posDecks[i])
        elseif i == 5 then --Tributary Deck
            deck.setPositionSmooth(posDecks[5])
            w(2)
            --Shuffles Decks
            zoneObjects = getObjectFromGUID(ShuffleZoneGUID).getObjects()
            for _, object in ipairs(zoneObjects) do
                if object.type == "Deck" then
                    object.shuffle()
                end
            end

            -- Remove appropriate number of fame cards
            deck = getObjectFromGUID(cardSetGUID[4])
            if playerCount == 2 then
              getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck.takeObject())
              getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck.takeObject())
            elseif playerCount == 3 then
              getObjectFromGUID(TrashId).putObject(deck.takeObject())
            end
            w(1)

            --Set down unrest
            zoneObjects = getObjectFromGUID(UnrestZoneGUID).getObjects()
            for _, object in ipairs(zoneObjects) do
                if object.type == "Deck" then
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {posDecks[1][1], object.getPosition()[2], object.getPosition()[3]},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {posDecks[2][1], object.getPosition()[2], object.getPosition()[3]},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {-4.75, object.getPosition()[2], object.getPosition()[3]},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {-9.75, object.getPosition()[2], object.getPosition()[3]},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                break
                end
            end

            w(0.5)

            --Puts all decks at their appropriate spots
            zoneObjects = getObjectFromGUID(DecksZoneGUID).getObjects()
            for i, object in ipairs(zoneObjects) do
                if object.type == "Deck" then
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {object.getPosition()[1], object.getPosition()[2] + 0.5, object.getPosition()[3] - 10.5},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                end
            end

            zoneObjects = getObjectFromGUID(GeneralDeckZoneGUID).getObjects()
            for _, object in ipairs(zoneObjects) do
                if object.type == "Deck" then
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {object.getPosition()[1] + 2.5, object.getPosition()[2] + 0.5, object.getPosition()[3] - 10.5},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                    object.takeObject({
                        position          = {object.getPosition()[1] - 2.5, object.getPosition()[2] + 0.5, object.getPosition()[3] - 10.5},
                        rotation          = {0.00, 180.00, 0.00},
                        smooth            = true,
                    })
                break
                end
            end

            w(1)

            -- Place progress at civilized only cards
            zoneObjects = getObjectFromGUID(MarketRowZoneGUID).getObjects()
            local progressTokenBag = getObjectFromGUID(ProgressTokenBagGUID)
            for _, object in ipairs(zoneObjects) do
              if object.type == 'Card' and object.hasTag('Civilized') and not object.hasTag('Uncivilized') then
                local pos = object.getPosition()
                pos[2] = pos[2] + 0.5
                progressTokenBag.takeObject({
                  position = pos,
                  rotation = {0, 180, 0}
                })
              end
            end
        end
    end

    local notes = "[u]Scripted Scoring[/u]: Cards left in a player's hand and boxed regions (Draw, Discard, History, Play Area, and Power) will automatically be scored." ..
    " The 'Sumerians' card will not remove 2 'Unrest' cards but will pretend they don't exist for scoring purposes."

    if SoloGame then
      notes = notes .. "\n\n[u]Bot Scoring[/u]: At the end of the game, place the Bot's draw deck and discard into the Bot's 'Play Area' before running the script."

      -- setup solo tokens
      local soloBag = getObjectFromGUID(soloBagGUID)
      for i = 1, #soloTokensGUID do
        soloBag.takeObject({
          guid = soloTokensGUID[i],
          position = posSoloTokens[i],
          rotation = {0, 180, 0}
        })
      end

      soloBag.takeObject({
        guid = 'e43770',
        rotation = {0, 180, 0}
      }).setPositionSmooth({-36.50, 1.5, 25.00}, false, true)
    end

    Notes.setNotes(notes)

    if SoloGame then
      broadcastToAll("The rest of the Bot will need to be setup manually.")
      w(3)
      broadcastToAll("Good luck and have fun!")
    else
      local seatedPlayers = getSeatedPlayersWithHands()
      local firstPlayerIndex = math.random(1, #seatedPlayers)
      local firstPlayer = Player[seatedPlayers[firstPlayerIndex]]
      broadcastToAll("The first player will be " .. firstPlayer.steam_name ..".", firstPlayer.color)
    end

    return 1
end


function makeItSnappy()
    snapsBoard = {}
    snapX = -75 --0.33
    snapY = 10 -- -0.911 -- -0.966
    snapSpaceX = 5 -- -0.077
    snapSpaceY = -1.2 -- 0.11

    for i=1, 30 do
        for y=1, 20 do
            table.insert(snapsBoard, {
                position = {snapX+snapSpaceX*i, 1, snapY+snapSpaceY*y},
                rotation = {0, 180, 0},
                rotation_snap = true,
                })
        end
    end


    Global.setSnapPoints(snapsBoard)

end


function w(some)
    local Time = os.clock() + some
    while os.clock() < Time do
        coroutine.yield(0)
    end
end

  Green = {{17.00, 0.98, -17.00}, {23.00, 0.98, -17.00}, {29.00, 0.98, -17.00}, {23.00, 0.98, -24.00}, {29.00, 0.98, -24.00}},
  Blue = {{53.00, 0.98, -17.00}, {59.00, 0.98, -17.00}, {65.00, 0.98, -17.00}, {59.00, 0.98, -24.00}, {65.00, 0.98, -24.00}}
}

SumeriansCardGUID = '61d69e'
CheckerGUID = '8a0e07'
PlayerTagValues = {}
PlayerInPlayTagValues = {}
SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID = {}
SelectedNationsGUID = {}
SavedPositionsGUID = {}
SoloGame = false
SoloSelectForWho = 0  -- 0 = for player, 1 = for bot

function calculateFinalScore()
  startLuaCoroutine(self, "calculateFinalScoreCo")
end

function calculateFinalScoreCo()
  local checkerObj = getObjectFromGUID(CheckerGUID)
  local players = getSeatedPlayersWithHands()
  local playerScore = {}

  checkerObj.clearButtons()
  broadcastToAll("Calculating score...")

  -- First need to do a count of all the card categories since some cards will rely on what other players have
  for _, playerColor in ipairs(players) do
    local countedTags = countCardTagsForPlayer(playerColor)
    PlayerTagValues[playerColor] = countedTags.tags
    PlayerInPlayTagValues[playerColor] = countedTags.inPlayTags

    -- Add resource count into the tags
    PlayerTagValues[playerColor]['Materials'] = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerTokensGUID[playerColor].materials).getVar('count')
    PlayerTagValues[playerColor]['Population'] = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerTokensGUID[playerColor].population).getVar('count')
    PlayerTagValues[playerColor]['Progress'] = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerTokensGUID[playerColor].progress).getVar('count')
  end

  -- Calculate the final score for all players
  for _, playerColor in ipairs(players) do
    playerScore[playerColor] = calculatePlayerScore(playerColor)
  end

  createCalculateScoreButton()

  -- Display score for each player
  local i = 0
  local notes = '[u]**Score**[/u]\n\n'
  local sortedScore = {}
  for k, v in pairs(playerScore) do
    table.insert(sortedScore, {color = k, score = v})
  end

  table.sort(sortedScore, function(a, b) return a.score > b.score end)

  broadcastToAll("** Results **", {1, 1, 1})
  for k, v in pairs(sortedScore) do
    local lblPlayerName = Player[v.color].steam_name
    local color = Color[Player[v.color].color]:toHex()

    if lblPlayerName == nil then
      lblPlayerName = 'BOT'
    end

    notes = notes .. '[' .. color .. ']' .. lblPlayerName .. "'s score: " .. v.score .. " VPs\n"

    broadcastToAll(lblPlayerName .. "'s score: " .. v.score .. " VPs", Player[v.color].color)
    i = i + 1
  end
  Notes.setNotes(notes)
  return 1
end

function getSeatedPlayersWithHands()
  local seatedPlayers = getSeatedPlayers()
  local result = {}

  if DEBUG then
    return Players
  end

  for _, seatedPlayer in ipairs(seatedPlayers) do
    for _, player in ipairs(Players) do
      if seatedPlayer == player then
        table.insert(result, player)
        break
      end
    end
  end

  if SoloGame then
    table.insert(result, BotColor)
  end

  return result
end

function getIfInHistory(player, objGUID)
  local zone = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerRegionsGUID[player].history)
  for _, obj in zone.getObjects() do
    if obj.getGUID() == objGUID then
      return true
    end

    if obj.type == 'Deck' then
      for _, card in obj.getObjects() do
        if card.getGUID() == objGUID then
          return true;
        end
      end
    end
  end

  return false
end

function getIfGarrisoned(player, obj, cardGuid)
  if not getIfInPlayZone(player, obj) then
    return false
  end

  -- Handle special case scenario if the card in question might be in a stack
  if obj.type == 'Deck' and not obj.is_face_down then
    local cards = obj.getObjects()
    if cards[#cards].guid ~= cardGuid then
      return true
    end
  end

  local castPos = obj.getPosition()
  castPos[2] = castPos[2] + 0.03
  local hits = Physics.cast({
    origin        = castPos,
    direction     = {0, 1, 0},
    type          = 1,
    max_distance  = 0.5,
  })

  for _, hit in pairs(hits) do
    if hit.hit_object.guid ~= obj.guid then
      return true
    end
  end

  return false
end

function getIfInPlayZone(player, obj)
  local zones = obj.getZones()
  for _, zone in pairs(zones) do
    if zone.guid == PlayerRegionsGUID[player].inPlay then
      return true
    end
  end

  return false
end

function createCalculateScoreButton()
  local checker = getObjectFromGUID(CheckerGUID)
  if checker == nil then
    return
  end
  checker.setLuaScript('')
  checker.createButton({
    click_function = "calculateFinalScore",
    function_owner = Global,
    label          = "Calculate Score",
    position       = {0, 0.5, 0},
    rotation       = {0, 0, 0},
    width          = 2500,
    height         = 400,
    font_size      = 300,
    tooltip        = '',
  })
end

function countCardTagsForPlayer(playerColor)
  local countedTags = {}
  local countedInPlayTags = {}

  hasSumerians = false

  -- init empty table
  for _, tag in ipairs(CountableTags) do
    countedTags[tag] = 0
  end
  for _, tag in ipairs(CountableIcons) do
    countedTags[tag] = 0
  end
  for _, tag in ipairs(CountableEtc) do
    countedTags[tag] = 0
  end
  for _, tag in ipairs(CountableInPlayTags) do
    countedInPlayTags[tag] = 0
  end

  for _, zoneGUID in pairs(PlayerRegionsGUID[playerColor]) do
    countCardTagsAtZone(playerColor, getObjectFromGUID(zoneGUID), countedTags, countedInPlayTags)
  end

  if hasSumerians then
    countedTags['Unrest'] = math.max(0, countedTags['Unrest'] - 2)
  end

  return {
    tags = countedTags,
    inPlayTags = countedInPlayTags
  }
end

-- Extra tags are tags that appear more than once on the card
function addExtraTags(obj, count)
  local tags = obj.getVar('ExtraTags')
  for k, v in pairs(tags) do
    if count[k] ~= nil then
      count[k] = count[k] + v
    end
  end
end

function countCardTagsAtZone(player, zone, countedTags, countedInPlayTags)
  local inPlayZone = zone.guid == PlayerRegionsGUID[player].inPlay

  for _, obj in ipairs(zone.getObjects()) do
    if obj.type == "Card" then
      local inPlay = inPlayZone and not getIfGarrisoned(player, obj, obj.guid)
      -- Count main tags
      for _, tag in ipairs(obj.getTags()) do
        if countedTags[tag] ~= nil then
          countedTags[tag] = countedTags[tag] + 1
        end

        if inPlay and countedInPlayTags[tag] ~= nil then
          countedInPlayTags[tag] = countedInPlayTags[tag] + 1
        end

        if tag == 'Extra Tags' then
          addExtraTags(obj, countedTags)
          if inPlay then
            addExtraTags(obj, countedInPlayTags)
          end
        end
      end

      -- Special conditional tag
      if inPlay and obj.hasTag('Pinned') and not obj.hasTag('Region') then
        countedInPlayTags['Pinned Not Region'] = countedInPlayTags['Pinned Not Region'] + 1
      end

      -- Count the icons on the cards
      for _, icon in ipairs(CountableIcons) do
        local val = obj.getVar(icon)
        if val ~= nil then
          countedTags[icon] = countedTags[icon] + val
        end
      end

      countedTags['Cards'] = countedTags['Cards'] + 1
      if obj.guid == SumeriansCardGUID then
        hasSumerians = true
      end

    -- Cards in a deck are stored as tables, need to do some wierd stuff to get the correct values
    elseif obj.type == "Deck" then
      local checkerObj = getObjectFromGUID(CheckerGUID)
      local inPlay = false

      for _, card in ipairs(obj.getObjects()) do
        for _, tag in ipairs(card.tags) do
          if countedTags[tag] ~= nil then
            countedTags[tag] = countedTags[tag] + 1
          end

          -- Last card, count tags if its inplay
          if inPlayZone and card.index == obj.getQuantity() - 1 and not getIfGarrisoned(player, obj, card.guid) and countedInPlayTags[tag] ~= nil then
            inPlay = true
            countedInPlayTags[tag] = countedInPlayTags[tag] + 1
          end
        end

        checkerObj.setLuaScript(card.lua_script)
        checkerObj.setTags(card.tags)
        checkerObj = checkerObj.reload()
        w(0.005) -- Don't know what the minimum time is until an object is created
        for _, icon in ipairs(CountableIcons) do
          local val = checkerObj.getVar(icon)
          if val ~= nil then
            countedTags[icon] = countedTags[icon] + val
          end
        end

        if checkerObj.hasTag('Extra Tags') then
          addExtraTags(checkerObj, countedTags)
          if inPlay then
            addExtraTags(checkerObj, countedInPlayTags)
          end
        end

        if inPlay and checkerObj.hasTag('Pinned') and not checkerObj.hasTag('Region') then
          countedInPlayTags['Pinned Not Region'] = countedInPlayTags['Pinned Not Region'] + 1
        end

        if card.guid == SumeriansCardGUID then
          hasSumerians = true
        end
      end

      countedTags['Cards'] = countedTags['Cards'] + obj.getQuantity()
    end
  end
end

function calculatePlayerScore(player)
  local score = 0

  for _, zoneGUID in pairs(PlayerRegionsGUID[player]) do
    score = score + scoreCardsAtZone(player, getObjectFromGUID(zoneGUID))
  end

  score = score + PlayerTagValues[player].Unrest * -2
  score = score + getObjectFromGUID(PlayerTokensGUID[player].progress).getVar('count')

  if SoloGame and player == BotColor then
    local materials = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerTokensGUID[player].materials).getVar('count')
    local population = getObjectFromGUID(PlayerTokensGUID[player].population).getVar('count')
    if BotScoreType == 1 then
      score = score + math.floor(materials / 10)
      score = score + math.floor(population / 10)
    elseif BotScoreType == 2 then
      score = score + math.floor(materials / 5)
      score = score + math.floor(population / 5)
    end
  end

  return score
end

function scoreCardsAtZone(player, zone)
  local score = 0
  local checkerObj = getObjectFromGUID(CheckerGUID)

  local inHistory = zone.guid == PlayerRegionsGUID[player].history
  local inPlayArea = zone.guid == PlayerRegionsGUID[player].inPlay

  for _, obj in ipairs(zone.getObjects()) do
    if obj.type == 'Card' then

      local objParams = {
        inHistory = inHistory,
        inGarrison = false,
        inPlay = false,
        isFaceDown = obj.is_face_down
      }

      if inPlayArea then
        objParams.inGarrison = getIfGarrisoned(player, obj, obj.guid)
        objParams.inPlay = not objParams.inGarrison
      end

      local cardValue = scoreObj(obj, player, obj.guid, objParams)
      --obj.setDescription("VPs earned: " .. cardValue)
      score = score + cardValue

    elseif obj.type == 'Deck' then
      for _, card in ipairs(obj.getObjects()) do
        checkerObj.setName(card.name)
        checkerObj.setLuaScript(card.lua_script)
        checkerObj.setTags(card.tags)
        checkerObj = checkerObj.reload()
        w(0.005)
        local objParams = {
          inHistory = inHistory,
          isFaceDown = obj.is_face_down,
          deckObj = obj
        }

        if inPlayArea then
          objParams.inGarrison = getIfGarrisoned(player, obj, card.guid)
          objParams.inPlay = not objParams.inGarrison
        end

        local cardValue = scoreObj(checkerObj, player, card.guid, objParams)
        --card.description = "VPs earned: " .. cardValue
        score = score + cardValue
      end
    end
  end

  checkerObj.setName("")

  return score
end

-- Concatenates table2 into table1
function concatTable(table1, table2)
  for k, v in pairs(table2) do
    table1[k] = v
  end
end

-- Call the obj's getVP function. The origGUID is the GUID of the original object
-- since the object itself might be the placeholder object if the original object
-- is in a container
function scoreObj(obj, player, origGUID, objParams)
  local status = false
  local result = nil

  -- Bot has special scoring rules
  if SoloGame and BotColor == player then
    if obj.hasTag('X VP') then
      status, result = pcall(getVP, obj)
    elseif obj.hasTag('Question VP') then
      status, result = pcall(getBotVP, obj)
    elseif obj.hasTag('Star VP') then
      status = true
      result = 5
    else
      return 0
    end

    if not status or result == nil then
      local msg = 'ERROR: Failed scoring card "' .. obj.getName() .. '" (guid:' .. origGUID .. ') for ' .. player
      broadcastToAll(msg, {1, 0, 0})
      return 0
    end

    return result
  end

  local params = {
    obj = obj,
    cardGUID = origGUID,
    player = player,
  }

  concatTable(params, objParams)

  -- If not null, it the object is a card in the deck
  if objParams.deckObj ~= nil then
    params.obj = objParams.deckObj
  end

  if obj.hasTag('X VP') or obj.hasTag('Question VP') or obj.hasTag('Star VP') then
    status, result = pcall(getVP, obj, params)
    -- Sometimes status returns true when result is nil for some reason
    if not status or result == nil then
      local msg = 'ERROR: Failed scoring card "' .. obj.getName() .. '" (guid:' .. origGUID .. ') for ' .. player
      broadcastToAll(msg, {1, 0, 0})
      log(msg)
      return 0
    end
  else
    return 0
  end

  if obj.hasTag('Star VP') then
    result = math.min(result, 10)
  end

  return result
end

function getVP(obj, params)
  return obj.call('getVP', params)
end

function getBotVP(obj)
  return obj.call('getBotVP')
end

function getTagValue(params)
  local tags = PlayerTagValues[params.player]
  if tags == nil then
    return nil
  end

  return tags[params.name]
end

function getInPlayTagValue(params)
  local tags = PlayerInPlayTagValues[params.player]
  if tags == nil then
    return nil
  end

  return tags[params.name]
end

function getOtherUnrestTotal(params)
  local sum = 0
  for _, playerColor in ipairs(Players) do
    if params.player ~= playerColor then
      local val = getTagValue({
        player = playerColor,
        name = "Unrest"
      })

      if val ~= nil then
        sum = sum + val
      end
    end
  end
  return sum
end

function countCardsInZone(zone)
  local sum = 0
    for _, obj in ipairs(zone.getObjects()) do
      if obj.type == 'Card' then
        sum = sum + 1
      elseif obj.type == 'Deck' then
        sum = sum + obj.getQuantity()
      end
    end
  return sum
end

function getHistoryCardCount(params)
  return countCardsInZone(getObjectFromGUID(PlayerRegionsGUID[params.player].history))
end

function getExileCardCount(params)
  return countCardsInZone(getObjectFromGUID(ExileZoneGUID))
end

function getGarrisonCount(params)
  if not getIfInPlayZone(params.player, params.obj) then
    return 0
  end

  local n = countCardsUnderThis(params.player, params.obj, 0)
  return n
end

function countCardsUnderThis(player, obj, n)
  local count = 0

  -- failsafe for inf recursion
  if n > 10 then
    return 0
  end

  if obj.type == 'Card' then
    count = 1
  elseif obj.type == 'Deck' then
    count = obj.getQuantity()
  else
    return 0
  end

  -- Dont count the card itself if at top level
  if n == 0 then
    count = count - 1
  end

  -- Check if there is a card or deck underneath
  local hits = Physics.cast({
    origin        = obj.getPosition(),
    direction     = {0, -1, 0},
    type          = 1,
    max_distance  = 0.25
  })

  for _, hit in ipairs(hits) do
    if hit.hit_object.guid ~= obj.guid then
      count = count + countCardsUnderThis(player, hit.hit_object, n + 1)
      break
    end
  end

  return count
end

function createNationSetupButtons()
  for _, guid in ipairs(NationPowerCardsGUID) do
    getObjectFromGUID(guid).hide_when_face_down = false
    createNationSetupButton(guid)
  end
end

function createNationSetupButton(guid)
  local card = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
  card.clearButtons()

  -- If nation already selected, don't create buttons
  if SelectedNationsGUID["_" .. guid] ~= nil then
    return
  end

  if not card.is_face_down then
      card.createButton({
        click_function = "nationSetupClick",
        function_owner = Global,
        label = "Select " .. card.GetName(),
        position = {0, 0.5, 2},
        width = 1500,
        height = 250,
        font_size = 150,
      })
  else
      card.createButton({
        click_function = "nationSetupClick",
        function_owner = Global,
        label = "Select " .. card.GetName(),
        position = {0, -0.5, 2},
        rotation = {0, 0, 180},
        width = 1500,
        height = 250,
        font_size = 150,
      })
  end
end

function nationSetupClick(obj, playerColor, altClick)
  if Player[playerColor].getHandCount() == 0 then
    broadcastToColor('Please take a seat before you select a nation.', playerColor)
    return
  end

  local cardSet = obj.getVar('CardSet')

  if cardSet == nil then
    broadcastToAll(obj.getName() .. " missing Card set values", {1, 0, 0})
    return
  end

  if SoloGame and SoloSelectForWho == 1 then
    playerColor = BotColor
  end

  -- Return previous selected nation cards if it exists
  if SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID[playerColor] ~= nil then
    local card = getObjectFromGUID(SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID[playerColor])
    local prevCardSet = card.getVar('CardSet')

    for _, v in pairs(prevCardSet) do
      if type(v) == 'table' then
        for _, w in ipairs(v) do
          local cards = getObjectFromGUID(w)
          if cards ~= nil then
              cards.setPositionSmooth(SavedPositionsGUID["_" .. w], false, true)
              cards.setLock(true)
          end
        end
      else
        local cards = getObjectFromGUID(v)
        if cards ~= nil then
            cards.setPositionSmooth(SavedPositionsGUID["_" .. v], false, true)
            cards.setLock(true)
        end
      end
    end

    SelectedNationsGUID["_" .. card.guid] = nil
    createNationSetupButton(prevCardSet.power)
  end

  SelectedNationsByPlayerGUID[playerColor] = obj.getGUID()
  SelectedNationsGUID["_" .. obj.getGUID()] = true

  -- Save positions of the newly selected nation cards
  for _, v in pairs(cardSet) do
    if type(v) == 'table' then
      for _, guid in ipairs(v) do
        local cards = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
        if cards ~= nil then
            SavedPositionsGUID["_" .. guid] = cards.getPosition()
        end
      end
    else
        local cards = getObjectFromGUID(v)
        if cards ~= nil then
            SavedPositionsGUID["_" .. v] = getObjectFromGUID(v).getPosition()
        end
    end
  end

  -- Move cards into player's region
  moveNationCards(playerColor, 1, cardSet.development)
  moveNationCards(playerColor, 2, cardSet.nation)
  moveNationCards(playerColor, 3, cardSet.supply)
  moveNationCards(playerColor, 4, cardSet.power)
  moveNationCards(playerColor, 5, cardSet.deck)
  moveNationCards(playerColor, 0, cardSet.etc)

  if SoloSelectForWho == nil then
    SoloSelectForWho = 0
  end

  if SoloGame then
    SoloSelectForWho = (SoloSelectForWho + 1) % 2
    if SoloSelectForWho == 1 then
      broadcastToAll("The next nation you select will be for the Bot.", {1, 1, 1})
    end
  end

  obj.clearButtons()
end

function moveNationCards(playerColor, setupPosIndex, guid)
  if guid == nil then
    return
  end

  -- ETC cards
  if setupPosIndex < 1 then
    local pos = PlayerSetupPos[playerColor][4]
    local cards = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
    if cards ~= nil then
        cards.setPositionSmooth({pos[1] - 12, pos[2], pos[3]}, false, true)
        cards.setLock(false)
    end
    return
  end

  if type(guid) == 'table' then
    for i, v in ipairs(guid) do
      local pos = PlayerSetupPos[playerColor][setupPosIndex]
      local cards = getObjectFromGUID(v)
      if cards ~= nil then
          cards.setPositionSmooth({pos[1], pos[2] + (i - 1) * 0.2, pos[3]}, false, true)
          cards.setLock(false)
          if i == 2 then
            cards.shuffle()
          end
      end
    end
  else
    local cards = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
    if cards ~= nil then
        cards.setPositionSmooth(PlayerSetupPos[playerColor][setupPosIndex], false, true)
        cards.setLock(false)
        if setupPosIndex == 5 then
          cards.shuffle()
        end
    end
  end
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Token
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
-- Universal Counter Tokens      coded by: MrStump

--Saves the count value into a table (data_to_save) then encodes it into the Tabletop save
function onSave()
    local data_to_save = {saved_count = count}
    saved_data = JSON.encode(data_to_save)
    return saved_data
end

--Loads the saved data then creates the buttons
function onload(saved_data)
    generateButtonParamiters()
    --Checks if there is a saved data. If there is, it gets the saved value for 'count'
    if saved_data != '' then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        count = loaded_data.saved_count
    else
        --If there wasn't saved data, the default value is set to 0.
        count = 0
    end

    --Generates the buttons after putting the count value onto the 'display' button
    b_display.label = tostring(count)
    if count >= 100 then
        b_display.font_size = 720
    else
        b_display.font_size = 1000
    end
    self.createButton(b_display)
    self.createButton(b_plus)
    self.createButton(b_minus)  
end

--Activates when + is hit. Adds 1 to 'count' then updates the display button.
function increase()
    count = count + 1
    updateDisplay()
end

--Activates when - is hit. Subtracts 1 from 'count' then updates the display button.
function decrease()
    --Prevents count from going below 0
    if count > 0 then
        count = count - 1
        updateDisplay()
    end
end

--Activates when + is hit. Adds 5 to 'count' then updates the display button.
function increase5()
    count = count + 5
    updateDisplay()
end

--Activates when - is hit. Subtracts 5 from 'count' then updates the display button.
function decrease5()
    --Prevents count from going below 0
    if count > 4 then
        count = count - 5
    else
        count = 0
    end
    updateDisplay()
end

function customSet()
    local description = self.getDescription()
    if description != '' and type(tonumber(description)) == 'number' then
        self.setDescription('')
        count = tonumber(description)
        updateDisplay()
    end
end

--function that updates the display. I trigger it whenever I change 'count'
function updateDisplay()
    --If statement to resize font size if it gets too long
    if count >= 100 then
        b_display.font_size = 720
    else
        b_display.font_size = 1000
    end
    b_display.label = tostring(count)
    self.editButton(b_display)
end

--This is activated when onload runs. This sets all paramiters for our buttons.
--I do not have to put this all into a function, but I prefer to do it this way.
function generateButtonParamiters()
    b_display = {
        index = 0, click_function = 'customSet', function_owner = self, label = '',
        position = {0,0.1,-3.75}, width = 1000, height = 1000, font_size = 1000
    }
    b_plus = {
        click_function = 'increase', function_owner = self, label =  '+1',
        position = {1.6,0.1,-3.35}, width = 600, height = 600, font_size = 400
    }
    b_minus = {
        click_function = 'decrease', function_owner = self, label =  '-1',
        position = {-1.6,0.1,-3.35}, width = 600, height = 600, font_size = 400
    }
    b_plus5 = {
        click_function = 'increase5', function_owner = self, label =  '+5',
        position = {0.75,0.1,-0.29}, width = 150, height = 230, font_size = 200
    }

-- Universal Counter Tokens      coded by: MrStump

--Saves the count value into a table (data_to_save) then encodes it into the Tabletop save
function onSave()
    local data_to_save = {saved_count = count}
    saved_data = JSON.encode(data_to_save)
    return saved_data
end

--Loads the saved data then creates the buttons
function onload(saved_data)
    generateButtonParamiters()
    --Checks if there is a saved data. If there is, it gets the saved value for 'count'
    if saved_data != '' then
        local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
        count = loaded_data.saved_count
    else
        --If there wasn't saved data, the default value is set to 0.
        count = 0
    end

    --Generates the buttons after putting the count value onto the 'display' button
    b_display.label = tostring(count)
    if count >= 100 then
        b_display.font_size = 720
    else
        b_display.font_size = 1000
    end
    self.createButton(b_display)
    self.createButton(b_plus)
    self.createButton(b_minus)  
end

--Activates when + is hit. Adds 1 to 'count' then updates the display button.
function increase()
    count = count + 1
    updateDisplay()
end

--Activates when - is hit. Subtracts 1 from 'count' then updates the display button.
function decrease()
    --Prevents count from going below 0
    if count > 0 then
        count = count - 1
        updateDisplay()
    end
end

--Activates when + is hit. Adds 5 to 'count' then updates the display button.
function increase5()
    count = count + 5
    updateDisplay()
end

--Activates when - is hit. Subtracts 5 from 'count' then updates the display button.
function decrease5()
    --Prevents count from going below 0
    if count > 4 then
        count = count - 5
    else
        count = 0
    end
    updateDisplay()
end

function customSet()
    local description = self.getDescription()
    if description != '' and type(tonumber(description)) == 'number' then
        self.setDescription('')
        count = tonumber(description)
        updateDisplay()
    end
end

--function that updates the display. I trigger it whenever I change 'count'
function updateDisplay()
    --If statement to resize font size if it gets too long
    if count >= 100 then
        b_display.font_size = 720
    else
        b_display.font_size = 1000
    end
    b_display.label = tostring(count)
    self.editButton(b_display)
end

--This is activated when onload runs. This sets all paramiters for our buttons.
--I do not have to put this all into a function, but I prefer to do it this way.
function generateButtonParamiters()
    b_display = {
        index = 0, click_function = 'customSet', function_owner = self, label = '',
        position = {0,0.1,-3.75}, width = 1000, height = 1000, font_size = 1000
    }
    b_plus = {
        click_function = 'increase', function_owner = self, label =  '+1',
        position = {1.6,0.1,-3.35}, width = 600, height = 600, font_size = 400
    }
    b_minus = {
        click_function = 'decrease', function_owner = self, label =  '-1',
        position = {-1.6,0.1,-3.35}, width = 600, height = 600, font_size = 400
    }
    b_plus5 = {
        click_function = 'increase5', function_owner = self, label =  '+5',
        position = {0.75,0.1,-0.29}, width = 150, height = 230, font_size = 200
    }
    b_minus5 = {
        click_function = 'decrease5', function_owner = self, label =  '-5',
        position = {-0.75,0.1,-0.29}, width = 150, height = 230, font_size = 200
    }
end

ObjectStates.LuaScript:
tableHeightOffset = -9.5

function onSave()
    saved_data = JSON.encode({tid=tableImageData, cd=checkData})
    --saved_data = ""
    return saved_data
end

function onload(saved_data)
    --Loads the tracking for if the game has started yet
    if saved_data ~= "" then
         local loaded_data = JSON.decode(saved_data)
         tableImageData = loaded_data.tid
         checkData = loaded_data.cd
    else
        tableImageData = {}
        checkData = {move=false, scale=false}
    end

    --Disables interactable status of objects with GUID in list
    for _, guid in ipairs(ref_noninteractable) do
        local obj = getObjectFromGUID(guid)
        if obj then obj.interactable = false end
    end

    --Establish references to table parts
    obj_leg1 = getObjectFromGUID("d828dc")
    obj_leg2 = getObjectFromGUID("d9de2e")
    obj_leg3 = getObjectFromGUID("5cd6c9")
    obj_leg4 = getObjectFromGUID("351822")
    obj_surface = getObjectFromGUID("9ef9b8")
    obj_side_top = getObjectFromGUID("eb1c39")
    obj_side_bot = getObjectFromGUID("1b8519")
    obj_side_lef = getObjectFromGUID("1c4ac9")
    obj_side_rig = getObjectFromGUID("83a120")

    controlActive = false
    createOpenCloseButton()
end



--Activation/deactivation of control panel



--Activated by clicking on
function click_toggleControl(_, color)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        if not controlActive then
            --Activate control panel
            controlActive = true
            self.clearButtons()
            createOpenCloseButton()
            createSurfaceInput()
            createSurfaceButtons()
            createScaleInput()
            createScaleButtons()
        else
            --Deactivate control panel
            controlActive = false
            self.clearButtons()
            self.clearInputs()
            createOpenCloseButton()

        end
    end
end




--Table surface control



--Changes table surface
function click_applySurface(_, color)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        updateSurface()
        broadcastToAll("New Table Image Applied", {0.2,0.9,0.2})
    end
end

--Saves table surface
function click_saveSurface(_, color)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        local nickname = self.getInputs()[1].value
        local url = self.getInputs()[2].value
        if nickname == "" then
            --No nickname
            broadcastToAll("Please supply a nickname for this save.", {0.9,0.2,0.2})
        else
            --Nickname exists

            if findInImageDataIndex(url, nickname) == nil then
                --Save doesn't exist already
                table.insert(tableImageData, {url=url, name=nickname})
                broadcastToAll("Image URL saved to memory.", {0.2,0.9,0.2})
                --Refresh buttons
                self.clearButtons()
                createOpenCloseButton()
                createSurfaceButtons()
                createScaleButtons()
            else
                --Save exists already
                broadcastToAll("Memory already contains a save with this Name or URL. Delete it first.", {0.9,0.2,0.2})
            end
        end
    end
end

--Loads table surface
function click_loadMemory(_, color, index)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        self.editInput({index=0, value=tableImageData[index].name})
        self.editInput({index=1, value=tableImageData[index].url})
        updateSurface()
        broadcastToAll("Table Image Loaded", {0.2,0.9,0.2})
    end
end

--Deletes table surface
function click_deleteMemory(_, color, index)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        table.remove(tableImageData, index)
        self.clearButtons()
        createOpenCloseButton()
        createSurfaceButtons()
        createScaleButtons()
        broadcastToAll("Element Removed from Memory", {0.2,0.9,0.2})
    end
end

--Updates surface from the values in the input field
function updateSurface()
    local customInfo = obj_surface.getCustomObject()
    customInfo.diffuse = self.getInputs()[2].value
    obj_surface.setCustomObject(customInfo)
    obj_surface = obj_surface.reload()
end



--Table Scale control



--Applies Scale to table pieces
function click_applyScale(_, color)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        local newWidth = tonumber(self.getInputs()[3].value)
        local newDepth = tonumber(self.getInputs()[4].value)
        if type(newWidth) ~= "number" then
            broadcastToAll("Invalid Width", {0.9,0.2,0.2})
            return
        elseif type(newDepth) ~= "number" then
            broadcastToAll("Invalid Depth", {0.9,0.2,0.2})
            return
        elseif newWidth<0.1 or newDepth<0.1 then
            broadcastToAll("Scale cannot go below 0.1", {0.9,0.2,0.2})
            return
        elseif newWidth>12 or newDepth>12 then
            broadcastToAll("Scale should not go over 12 (world size limitation)", {0.9,0.2,0.2})
            return
        else
            changeTableScale(math.abs(newWidth), math.abs(newDepth))
            broadcastToAll("Scale applied.", {0.2,0.9,0.2})
        end
    end
end

--Checks/unchecks move box for hands
function click_checkMove(_, color)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        local find_func = function(o) return o.click_function=="click_checkMove" end
        if checkData.move == true then
            checkData.move = false
            local buttonEntry = findButton(self, find_func)
            self.editButton({index=buttonEntry.index, label=""})
        else
            checkData.move = true
            local buttonEntry = findButton(self, find_func)
            self.editButton({index=buttonEntry.index, label=string.char(10008)})
        end
    end
end

--Checks/unchecks scale box for hands
--This button was disabled for technical reasons
--[[
function click_checkScale(_, color)
    if permissionCheck(color) then
        local find_func = function(o) return o.click_function=="click_checkScale" end
        if checkData.scale == true then
            checkData.scale = false
            local buttonEntry = findButton(self, find_func)
            self.editButton({index=buttonEntry.index, label=""})
        else
            checkData.scale = true
            local buttonEntry = findButton(self, find_func)
            self.editButton({index=buttonEntry.index, label=string.char(10008)})
        end
    end
end
]]

--Alters scale of elements and moves them
function changeTableScale(width, depth)
    --Scaling factors used to translate scale to position offset
    local width2pos = (width-1) * 18
    local depth2pos = (depth-1) * 18

    --Hand zone movement
    if checkData.move == true then
        for _, pc in ipairs(ref_playerColor) do
            if Player[pc].getHandCount() > 0 then
                moveHandZone(Player[pc], width2pos, depth2pos)
            end
        end
    end
    --Hand zone scaling
    --The button to enable this was disabled for technical reasons
    if checkData.scale == true then
        for _, pc in ipairs(ref_playerColor) do
            if Player[pc].getHandCount() > 0 then
                scaleHandZone(Player[pc], width, depth)
            end
        end
    end

    --Resizing table elements
    obj_side_top.setScale({width, 1, 1})
    obj_side_bot.setScale({width, 1, 1})
    obj_side_lef.setScale({depth, 1, 1})
    obj_side_rig.setScale({depth, 1, 1})
    obj_surface.setScale({width, 1, depth})

    --Moving table elements to accomodate new scale
    obj_side_lef.setPosition({-width2pos,tableHeightOffset,0})
    obj_side_rig.setPosition({ width2pos,tableHeightOffset,0})
    obj_side_top.setPosition({0,tableHeightOffset, depth2pos})
    obj_side_bot.setPosition({0,tableHeightOffset,-depth2pos})
    obj_leg1.setPosition({-width2pos,tableHeightOffset,-depth2pos})
    obj_leg2.setPosition({-width2pos,tableHeightOffset, depth2pos})
    obj_leg3.setPosition({ width2pos,tableHeightOffset, depth2pos})
    obj_leg4.setPosition({ width2pos,tableHeightOffset,-depth2pos})
    self.setPosition(obj_leg4.positionToWorld({-22.12, 8.74,-19.16}))
    --Only enabled when changing tableHeightOffset
    obj_surface.setPosition({0,tableHeightOffset,0})
end

--Move hand zone, p=player reference, facts are scaling factors
function moveHandZone(p, width2pos, depth2pos)
    local widthX = obj_side_rig.getPosition().x
    local depthZ = obj_side_top.getPosition().z
    for i=1, p.getHandCount() do
        local handT = p.getHandTransform()
        local pos = handT.position
        local y = handT.rotation.y

        if y<45 or y>320 or y>135 and y<225 then
            if pos.z > 0 then
                pos.z = pos.z + depth2pos - depthZ
            else
                pos.z = pos.z - depth2pos + depthZ
            end
        else
            if pos.x > 0 then
                pos.x = pos.x + width2pos - widthX
            else
                pos.x = pos.x - width2pos + widthX
            end
        end

        --Only enabled when changing tableHeightOffset
        --pos.y = tableHeightOffset + 14

        handT.position = pos
        p.setHandTransform(handT, i)
    end
end


---Scales hand zones, p=player reference, facts are scaling factors
function scaleHandZone(p, width, depth)
    local widthFact = width / obj_side_top.getScale().x
    local depthFact = depth / obj_side_lef.getScale().x
    for i=1, p.getHandCount() do
        local handT = p.getHandTransform()
        local scale = handT.scale
        local y = handT.rotation.y
        if y<45 or y>320 or y>135 and y<225 then
            scale.x = scale.x * widthFact
        else
            scale.x = scale.x * depthFact
        end
        handT.scale = scale
        p.setHandTransform(handT, i)
    end
end



--Information gathering



--Checks if a color is promoted or host
function permissionCheck(color)
    if Player[color].host==true or Player[color].promoted==true then
        return true
    else
        return false
    end
end

--Locates a string saved within memory file
function findInImageDataIndex(...)
    for _, str in ipairs({...}) do
        for i, v in ipairs(tableImageData) do
            if v.url == str or v.name == str then
                return i
            end
        end
    end
    return nil
end

--Round number (num) to the Nth decimal (dec)
function round(num, dec)
  local mult = 10^(dec or 0)
  return math.floor(num * mult + 0.5) / mult
end

--Locates a button with a helper function
function findButton(obj, func)
    if func==nil then error("No func supplied to findButton") end
    for _, v in ipairs(obj.getButtons()) do
        if func(v) then
            return v
        end
    end
    return nil
end



--Creation of buttons/inputs



function createOpenCloseButton()
    local tooltip = "Open Table Control Panel"
    if controlActive then
        tooltip = "Close Table Control Panel"
    end
    self.createButton({
        click_function="click_toggleControl", function_owner=self,
        position={0,0,0}, rotation={-45,0,0}, height=400, width=400,
        color={1,1,1,0}, tooltip=tooltip
    })
end

function createSurfaceInput()
    local currentURL = obj_surface.getCustomObject().diffuse
    local nickname = ""
    if findInImageDataIndex(currentURL) ~= nil then
        nickname = tableImageData[findInImageDataIndex(currentURL)].name
    end
    self.createInput({
        label="Nickname", input_function="none", function_owner=self,
        alignment=3, position={0,0,2}, height=224, width=4000,
        font_size=200, tooltip="Enter nickname for table image (only used for save)",
        value=nickname
    })
    self.createInput({
        label="URL", input_function="none", function_owner=self,
        alignment=3, position={0,0,3}, height=224, width=4000,
        font_size=200, tooltip="Enter URL for tabletop image",
        value=currentURL
    })
end

function createSurfaceButtons()
    --Label
    self.createButton({
        label="Tabletop Surface Image", click_function="none",
        position={0,0,1}, height=0, width=0, font_size=300, font_color={1,1,1}
    })
    --Functional
    self.createButton({
        label="Apply Image\nTo Table", click_function="click_applySurface",
        function_owner=self, tooltip="Apply URL as table image",
        position={2,0,4}, height=440, width=1400, font_size=200,
    })
    self.createButton({
        label="Save Image\nTo Memory", click_function="click_saveSurface",
        function_owner=self, tooltip="Record URL into memory (requires nickname)",
        position={-2,0,4}, height=440, width=1400, font_size=200,
    })
    --Label
    self.createButton({
        label="Load From Memory", click_function="none",
        position={0,0,5.5}, height=0, width=0, font_size=300, font_color={1,1,1}
    })
    --Saves, created dynamically from memory file
    for i, memoryEntry in ipairs(tableImageData) do
        --Load
        local funcName = i.."loadMemory"
        local func = function(x,y) click_loadMemory(x,y,i) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        self.createButton({
            label=memoryEntry.name, click_function=funcName,
            function_owner=self, tooltip=memoryEntry.url, font_size=200,
            position={-0.6,0,6.5+0.5*(i-1)}, height=240, width=3300,
        })
        --Delete
        local funcName = i.."deleteMemory"
        local func = function(x,y) click_deleteMemory(x,y,i) end
        self.setVar(funcName, func)
        self.createButton({
            label="DELETE", click_function=funcName,
            function_owner=self, tooltip="",
            position={3.6,0,6.5+0.5*(i-1)}, height=240, width=600,
            font_size=160, font_color={1,0,0}, color={0.8,0.8,0.8}
        })
    end
end

function createScaleInput()
    self.createInput({
        label=string.char(8644), input_function="none", function_owner=self,
        alignment=3, position={-8.5,0,2}, height=224, width=400,
        font_size=200, tooltip="Table Width",
        value=round(obj_side_top.getScale().x, 1)
    })
    self.createInput({
        label=string.char(8645), input_function="none", function_owner=self,
        alignment=3, position={-7.5,0,2}, height=224, width=400,
        font_size=200, tooltip="Table Depth",
        value=round(obj_side_lef.getScale().x, 1)
    })
end

function createScaleButtons()
    --Labels
    self.createButton({
        label="Table Scale", click_function="none",
        position={-8,0,1}, height=0, width=0, font_size=300, font_color={1,1,1}
    })
    self.createButton({
        label=string.char(8644).."            "..string.char(8645),
        click_function="none",
        position={-8,0,2}, height=0, width=0, font_size=300, font_color={1,1,1}
    })
    self.createButton({
        label="Move Hands:", click_function="none",
        position={-8.3,0,3}, height=0, width=0, font_size=200, font_color={1,1,1}
    })
    --Disabled due to me removing the feature for technical reasons
    --[[
    self.createButton({
        label="Scale Hands:", click_function="none",
        position={-8.3,0,4}, height=0, width=0, font_size=200, font_color={1,1,1}

    if checkData.move == true then label = string.char(10008) end
    self.createButton({
        label=label, click_function="click_checkMove",
        function_owner=self, tooltip="Check to move hands when table is rescaled",
        position={-6.8,0,3}, height=224, width=224, font_size=200,
    })
    --[[
    local label = ""
    if checkData.scale == true then label = string.char(10008) end
    self.createButton({
        label=label, click_function="click_checkScale",
        function_owner=self, tooltip="Check to scale the width of hands when table is rescaled",
        position={-6.8,0,4}, height=224, width=224, font_size=200,
    })
    ]]
    --Apply button
    self.createButton({
        label="Apply Scale", click_function="click_applyScale",
        function_owner=self, tooltip="Apply width/depth to table",
        position={-8,0,4}, height=440, width=1400, font_size=200,
    })
end

function getVP(params)
  local tags = Global.getVar('PlayerTagValues')
  local players = Global.call('getSeatedPlayersWithHands')

  local count = 0
  for i = 1, #players do
    if players[i] ~= params.player and tags[players[i]].Progress < tags[params.player].Progress then
      count = count + 1
    end
  end

  return count * 2
end

ObjectStates.LuaScript:
stateCardGUID = 'fbdfa7'
exhaustGUID = {'08652c', 'a13b94', '8c07fb', '80d47e', 'f6d49e'}
actionGUID = {'9fbce3', 'bf824d', 'e5b130'}

function onLoad()
    self.createButton({
        position = {0, 1, 0},
        click_function = "recallTokens",
        function_owner = self,
        label = "Recall",
        width = 1800,
        height = 500,
        font_size = 400,
        font_color = "White",
        color = "Black"
      })
end

function recallTokens()
  local stateCard = getObjectFromGUID(stateCardGUID)
  if stateCard == nil then
    return
  end

  local pos = stateCard.getPosition()

  local n = 4
  local wOff = 3
  local offset = wOff / n
  local x = pos[1] - wOff / 2

  for i, v in ipairs(exhaustGUID) do
    local exhaustToken = getObjectFromGUID(v)
    if exhaustToken ~= nil then
      exhaustToken.setPositionSmooth({x + offset * (i - 1), pos[2] + ((i + 1) % 2) * 0.5 + 0.5, pos[3] + 0.8 + ((i + 1) % 2) * -0.8}, false, true)
      exhaustToken.setRotation({0, 0, 0})
    end
  end

  n = 2
  offset = wOff / n
  for i, v in pairs(actionGUID) do
    local actionToken = getObjectFromGUID(v)
    if actionToken ~= nil then
      actionToken.setPositionSmooth({x + offset * (i - 1), pos[2] + 0.5, pos[3] - 1.5}, false, true)
      actionToken.setRotation({0, 0, 0})
    end
  end
end

ObjectStates.LuaScript:
stateCardGUID = 'e8926c'
exhaustGUID = {'3edfc1', 'c37486', '5e9232', '8f9645', '2ab042'}
actionGUID = {'7a8416', 'e39c64', 'de7a45'}

function onLoad()
    self.createButton({
        position = {0, 1, 0},
        click_function = "recallTokens",
        function_owner = self,
        label = "Recall",
        width = 1800,
        height = 500,
        font_size = 400,
        font_color = "White",
        color = "Black"
      })
end

function recallTokens()
  local stateCard = getObjectFromGUID(stateCardGUID)
  if stateCard == nil then
    return
  end

  local pos = stateCard.getPosition()

  local n = 4
  local wOff = 3
  local offset = wOff / n
  local x = pos[1] - wOff / 2

  for i, v in ipairs(exhaustGUID) do
    local exhaustToken = getObjectFromGUID(v)
    if exhaustToken ~= nil then
      exhaustToken.setPositionSmooth({x + offset * (i - 1), pos[2] + ((i + 1) % 2) * 0.5 + 0.5, pos[3] + 0.8 + ((i + 1) % 2) * -0.8}, false, true)
      exhaustToken.setRotation({0, 0, 0})
    end
  end

  n = 2
  offset = wOff / n
  for i, v in pairs(actionGUID) do
    local actionToken = getObjectFromGUID(v)
    if actionToken ~= nil then
      actionToken.setPositionSmooth({x + offset * (i - 1), pos[2] + 0.5, pos[3] - 1.5}, false, true)
      actionToken.setRotation({0, 0, 0})
    end
  end
end
